018
019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
022import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.util.Collections;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Map;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
029import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
030import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
031import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
032import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicModel;
033import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicModels;
034import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
035import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sObserver.ResponseType;
036import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmPool;
037import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM_POOL;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetPools;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmPoolChanged;
041import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
042import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
043import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
044import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
045import org.jgrapes.core.events.Attached;
046
047/**
048 * Watches for changes of VM pools. Reports the changes using 
049 * {@link VmPoolChanged} events fired on a special pipeline to
050 * avoid concurrent change informations.
051 */
052@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
053public class PoolMonitor extends
054        AbstractMonitor<K8sDynamicModel, K8sDynamicModels, Channel> {
055
056    private final Map<String, VmPool> pools = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
057    private EventPipeline poolPipeline;
058
059    /**
060     * Instantiates a new VM pool manager.
061     *
062     * @param componentChannel the component channel
063     * @param channelManager the channel manager
064     */
065    public PoolMonitor(Channel componentChannel) {
066        super(componentChannel, K8sDynamicModel.class,
067            K8sDynamicModels.class);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * On attached.
072     *
073     * @param event the event
074     */
075    @Handler
076    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
077    public void onAttached(Attached event) {
078        if (event.node() == this) {
079            poolPipeline = newEventPipeline();
080        }
081    }
082
083    @Override
084    protected void prepareMonitoring() throws IOException, ApiException {
085        client(new K8sClient());
086
087        // Get all our API versions
088        var ctx = K8s.context(client(), VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM_POOL);
089        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
090            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
091            return;
092        }
093        context(ctx.get());
094    }
095
096    @Override
097    protected void handleChange(K8sClient client,
098            Watch.Response<K8sDynamicModel> response) {
099
100        var type = ResponseType.valueOf(response.type);
101        var poolName = response.object.metadata().getName();
102
103        // When pool is deleted, save VMs in pending
104        if (type == ResponseType.DELETED) {
105            Optional.ofNullable(pools.get(poolName)).ifPresent(pool -> {
106                pool.setDefined(false);
107                if (pool.vms().isEmpty()) {
108                    pools.remove(poolName);
109                }
110                poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(pool, true));
111            });
112            return;
113        }
114
115        // Get full definition
116        var poolModel = response.object;
117        if (poolModel.data() == null) {
118            // ADDED event does not provide data, see
119            // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/3215
120            try {
121                poolModel = K8sDynamicStub.get(client(), context(), namespace(),
122                    poolModel.metadata().getName()).model().orElse(null);
123            } catch (ApiException e) {
124                return;
125            }
126        }
127
128        // Get pool and merge changes
129        var vmPool = pools.computeIfAbsent(poolName, k -> new VmPool(poolName));
130        var newData = client().getJSON().getGson().fromJson(
131            GsonPtr.to(poolModel.data()).to("spec").get(), VmPool.class);
132        vmPool.setPermissions(newData.permissions());
133        vmPool.setDefined(true);
134        poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(vmPool));
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Track VM definition changes.
139     *
140     * @param event the event
141     */
142    @Handler
143    public void onVmDefChanged(VmDefChanged event) {
144        String vmName = event.vmDefinition().name();
145        switch (event.type()) {
146        case ADDED:
147            event.vmDefinition().<List<String>> fromSpec("pools")
148                .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream().forEach(p -> {
149                    pools.computeIfAbsent(p, k -> new VmPool(p))
150                        .vms().add(vmName);
151                    poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(pools.get(p)));
152                });
153            break;
154        case DELETED:
155            pools.values().stream().forEach(p -> {
156                if (p.vms().remove(vmName)) {
157                    poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(p));
158                }
159            });
160            break;
161        default:
162            break;
163        }
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Return the requested pools.
168     *
169     * @param event the event
170     */
171    @Handler
172    public void onGetPools(GetPools event) {
173        event.setResult(pools.values().stream()
174            .filter(p -> event.forUser().isEmpty() && event.forRoles().isEmpty()
175                || !p.permissionsFor(event.forUser().orElse(null),
176                    event.forRoles()).isEmpty())
177            .toList());
178    }
179}
